member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO
member.summary: Describes an application that is to be registered with the Restart Manager.

member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO.Process
member.summary: Contains an structure that uniquely identifies the application by its PID and the time the process began.

member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO.strAppName
member.summary: If the process is a service, this parameter returns the long name for the service. If the process is not a service, this parameter returns the user-friendly name for the application. If the process is a critical process, and the installer is run with elevated privileges, this parameter returns the name of the executable file of the critical process. If the process is a critical process, and the installer is run as a service, this parameter returns the long name of the critical process.

member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO.strServiceShortName
member.summary: If the process is a service, this is the short name for the service. This member is not used if the process is not a service.

member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO.ApplicationType
member.summary: Contains an enumeration value that specifies the type of application as RmUnknownApp, RmMainWindow, RmOtherWindow, RmService, RmExplorer or RmCritical.

member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO.AppStatus
member.summary: Contains a bit mask that describes the current status of the application. See the enumeration.

member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO.TSSessionId
member.summary: Contains the Terminal Services session ID of the process. If the terminal session of the process cannot be determined, the value of this member is set to RM_INVALID_SESSION (-1). This member is not used if the process is a service or a system critical process.

member.name: RM_PROCESS_INFO.bRestartable
member.summary: TRUE if the application can be restarted by the Restart Manager; otherwise, FALSE. This member is always TRUE if the process is a service. This member is always FALSE if the process is a critical system process.
